adverbs.description: sidearm (comparative more sidearm, superlative most sidearm)

entries.meaning: With one's arm roughly parallel to the ground.
A personal weapon, such as a handgun or sword, carried on the hip in a belt, sheath, holster, etc., for rapid access.

verbs.description: sidearm (third-person singular simple present sidearms, present participle sidearming, simple past and past participle sidearmed)

entries.meaning: To throw a ball with one's arm roughly parallel to the ground.
